page.title: 01Upottery Village 1
page.content: {Upottery Village {Upottery}is situated in the {Otter {valley,}6 miles North-East of the market town of{Honiton. }With its neighbouring village of{Rawridge}it is the main area of population and has more ameneties than the rest of the vicinity which formed our survey area. The majority of land in the area is used for agricultural purposes. { Upottery} has a number of interesting buildings which tell us some of the history.The pub is called{The Sidmouth {Arms}after the former owner of the manor {Lord Sidmouth }who was the Prime Minister from 1801 to 1804. The Manor house is no longer standing but there is a farm known as Manor Farm and this was once a Bank issuing its own bank notes. The village also has a Justice Room where a court was once held.
